battleship.model

Interface BattleshipModel


  • public interface BattleshipModel
    Public Model Interface for Battleship game
    Version:
    11/28/2015
    Author:
    Bob McHenry, Chris Wilson, Jesse Bernoudy, Mario Rodriguez

    • Method Detail

      • getActivePlayer

        Player getActivePlayer()
        getActivePlayer returns the reference of the active player.
        Returns:
        activePlayer reference

      • getDefensePlayer

        Player getDefensePlayer()
        getDefensePlayer returns the reference of the defending player.
        Returns:
        defensePlayer reference

      • switchActivePlayer

        void switchActivePlayer()
        Called when a player has finished setup or has fired a shot that missed. Swaps the activePlayer and defensePlayer references to the appropriate Player objects.

      • getP1

        Player getP1()
        Returns:
        the Player stored in the game as Player 1

      • getP1Name

        java.lang.String getP1Name()
        Returns:
        Assigned name of Player 1 as a String

      • getP2

        Player getP2()
        Returns:
        the Player stored in the game as Player 2

      • getP2Name

        java.lang.String getP2Name()
        Returns:
        Assigned name of Player 2 as a String

      • resetGame

        void resetGame(java.lang.String p1Name,
               java.lang.String p2Name)
        Resets current game and reverts into setup mode with two new Players View/Controller will need to revert to setup mode.
        Parameters:
        p1Name - Player One name as String
        p2Name - Player Two name as String

      • placeShip

        boolean placeShip(java.lang.String s,
                  int headR,
                  int headC,
                  int tailR,
                  int tailC)
        Places a ship on the game board for the player designated as the activePlayer. Requires the type of ship being placed, as a String and the row and colum coordinates for the head and tail of the ship. Returns true on proper ship placement, false if the placement fails validation.
        Parameters:
        s - String representation of the ShipType being placed. Use aircraft carrier, cruiser, battleship, and destroyer.
        headR - The row coordinate value for the head of the ship.
        headC - The column coordinate value for the head of the ship.
        tailR - The row coordinate value for the tail of the ship.
        tailC - The column coordinate value for the tail of the ship.
        Returns:
        True if ship is placed on board, False if ship fails validation and is not placed.

      • getShipLocations

        Location[] getShipLocations(Player p)
        Returns an array of all the board Locations the designated player's ships occupy.
        Parameters:
        p - The player whose ship locations are being requested.
        Returns:
        an array of Location objects.

      • makeShot

        java.lang.String makeShot(int row,
                          int col)
        Once setup mode has ended, the makeShot method is used to make offensive moves. The activePlayer will fire at the designated row/col coordinates of the defensePlayer's board.
        Parameters:
        row - The targeted row of the offensive move.
        col - The targeted column of the offensive move.
        Returns:
        String message relaying status of hit.

      • isGameOver

        boolean isGameOver()
        isGameOver checks to see if a win condition has been met by either player. The method will loop through each players array of ships and check for a sunken condition with the Ship.isSunk method.
        Returns:
        True if win condition is met, false if gameplay should continue

      • getBoard

        boolean[] getBoard(Player p)
        Returns an array of True/False values that can be mapped to the gamegrid. Use Row# * 10 + Column# to get row index. False values are cells that have not yet been attacked. True values are previously attacked cells.
        Parameters:
        p - Designates which player's offense grid will be returned
        Returns:
        Boolean[] of players offensive shots.
